item.title: Homeless people living in a tent on Bromfield Court Green., 24th October
item.description:
Once again we have homeless living out of a tent on the green of Bromfield Court. There are two females who have been seen leaving the tent today. Whilst I am not without sympathy for anyone who is homeless I would be very grateful if the Council could find these women a home somewhere. The green is not a suitable place for them to be living especially as winter is coming. Thank you for you help in this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): John Roll Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Morrisons trolley on pavement, 24th October
item.description:
This has been there a few days and is likely in heavy wind to roll into and damage a vehicle. It will also encourage other people to leave items in the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appledore Crescent, Longlands, London

item.title: There has been a collision between a Nissan Juke and 276 bus on Osborne Road not far from Gainsborough school. There is hazards and safety concerns with the bend on Osborne Road towards Gainsborough school this is a daily occurrence of near miss and collisions. If somebody from the safety department could do a survey on this spot of Road. Nissan Juke car in collision causing obstruction.If Hackney Council got the barrier gate fix when people raised repair jobs and reports Leaseholders garage would not be blocked. Motor vehicles mounting the pavement to get around accident scene nearly hitting pedestrians. This section of road is causing multiple incidences with 276 buses involved. This section of road is a very tight bend and a pinch point which is causing collisions and accidents this is the third accident now involving a bus. Hackney Council ignoring residents safety concerns and closing reports not dealing with the issues raised. Mums and dads and families are concerned because this collision occurred around 3:30 when kids are coming out of school. If someone from Hackney Council safety department could do something about these issues raised., 24th October
item.description:
Collision at Osborne Road regular occurrence on this section of Road on the bend. It is a very dangerous pinch point between motorists and bus 276. Parents and residents and members of public are concerned with this regular occurrence of accidents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mallard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle route C6 on corner of Pakenham Street and Calthorpe Street, outside former Pakenham Arms, 24th October
item.description:
Car drivers frequently use the cycle path C6 between Phoenix Place and Wren Street as a cut-through, despite signs saying no entry and the fact that this is clearly marked as a cycle path only. Drivers are able to do this because the bollards are placed too widely to prevent cars driving through here. This behaviour presents a danger to pedestrians and cyclists, especially vulnerable road users. This practice is very commonplace (multiple times per hour on any given day). Please can an additional bollard be placed, or the position of the existing bollards moved, to prevent cars from doing this? Alternatively a camera could be installed to prevent motorists flouting the road signs at this location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pakenham Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gardening Bin Left on Roadside, 24th October
item.description:
Hi, It seems a gardening bin is left on our street probably for gardening work, however because it's left unattended, it attracted fly tipping from foot road users including animal feces bags. Garbage is full and not being collected by rubbish collection. I request it to be emptied and removed if it is going to remain unattended.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
